titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Caroline Suydam (Duer) McLanahan Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Janet Elaine Gertz

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:36

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of a scrapbook for the years 1893-1897 kept by Caroline Suydam Duer McLanahan. Included are invitations, calling cards, programs and other memorabilia relating to New Haven and New York social life and to social events at Yale University. Her husband, George X. McLanahan, was a member of the Yale College Class of 1896.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Caroline S. D. McLanahan Papers (MS 987). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of a scrapbook for the years 1893-1897 kept by Caroline Suydam Duer McLanahan. Included are invitations, calling cards, programs and other memorabilia relating to New Haven and New York social life and to social events at Yale University. Her husband, George X. McLanahan, was a member of the Yale College Class of 1896.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

controlaccess.geogname: New Haven (Conn.) -- Social life and customs
New York (State) -- Social life and customs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a scrapbook kept by Caroline Suydam (Duer) McLanahan during the years 1893-1897. In the book are mounted invitations, calling cards, programs, dance cards, newspaper clippings, and other memorabilia relating to New Haven and New York City society, and to social events at Yale University. Daughter of Denning Duer of New Haven, Caroline S. Duer later married George X. McLanahan of the Yale class of 1896.
